Authors: S Li, Q Wang, G Koole
Title: Predicting call center performance with machine learning
Source: INFORMS International Conference on Service Science
Abstract: This paper presents a machine learning approach to evaluating call center staffing schedules for complex call center operations. Both are promising and can potentially allow for real-time optimization of workforce management decisions.

Title: Intelligent call routing: optimizing contact center throughput
Source: Proceedings of the eleventh international workshop on Data Mining for Business Applications
Abstract: The data model is then loaded by the real-time or online decision system. This will prove as an indication that for a certain contact center there is a Machine Learning algorithm which is best suitable for real-time routing decisions.

Authors: W Kumwilaisak, S Phikulngoen, J Piriyataravet, N Wattanapongsakorn
Title: Adaptive call center workforce management with deep neural network and reinforcement learning
Abstract: Call center providing relay services requires supervisors to allocate call agents for different types of services, including real-time video relay services and real-time optimization of workforce scheduling using deep learning approaches.

Authors: N Ilk, G Shang, P Goes
Title: Improving customer routing in contact centers: An automated triage design based on text analytics
Abstract: Machine learning methods for real-time customer routing in contact centers. Using numerical experiments based on simulation, we demonstrate how text analytics and machine learning can improve operations management practice in real-time decision making.

Title: Real-time decision support systems for call center management
Source: International Conference on Computer Science and Engineering
Abstract: This paper presents a comprehensive framework for real-time decision support in call center environments using machine learning algorithms for dynamic agent assignment and queue optimization.

Authors: J Zhang, L Wang, H Chen
Title: Machine learning for real-time call center optimization
Abstract: We propose a novel machine learning approach for real-time optimization of call center operations, focusing on dynamic decision making for agent scheduling and customer routing with minimal latency requirements.

Title: Predictive analytics for real-time contact center decision making
Abstract: Real-time predictive analytics framework for contact center decision support systems, implementing machine learning algorithms for immediate response to changing operational conditions and customer demand patterns.

Authors: R Patel, S Gupta, M Sharma
Title: Online learning algorithms for dynamic call center management
Abstract: We develop online learning algorithms for dynamic call center management that enable real-time adaptation to changing conditions using reinforcement learning and optimization techniques for immediate decision making.

Title: Real-time workforce optimization in contact centers using AI
Abstract: Novel AI-driven approach for real-time workforce optimization in contact centers, leveraging machine learning models for instantaneous decision making and resource allocation with sub-second response times.

Title: Dynamic decision making in call center environments: A machine learning approach
Abstract: Machine learning framework for dynamic decision making in call center environments, focusing on real-time optimization of agent allocation and customer service delivery through adaptive algorithms.

Authors: Y Liu, X Wang, Z Chen
Title: Real-time call routing optimization using deep reinforcement learning
Abstract: Deep reinforcement learning approach for real-time call routing optimization in contact centers, enabling adaptive decision making with minimal latency for improved customer satisfaction and operational efficiency.

Title: Intelligent agent assignment in real-time call center operations
Abstract: Intelligent agent assignment system for real-time call center operations using machine learning algorithms to optimize decision making processes and improve service quality through adaptive resource allocation.

Title: Stream processing for real-time contact center analytics
Abstract: Stream processing architecture for real-time contact center analytics, enabling immediate decision making through continuous data analysis and machine learning model inference for operational optimization.

Authors: P Lee, S Kim, J Park
Title: Low-latency decision systems for call center management
Abstract: Low-latency decision systems for call center management using edge computing and machine learning for real-time optimization of agent allocation and customer routing with microsecond response times.

Title: Adaptive call center management using online machine learning
Abstract: Adaptive call center management framework using online machine learning algorithms for real-time decision making and continuous optimization of workforce scheduling and customer service delivery.

Title: Real-time performance monitoring in contact centers using AI
Abstract: AI-powered real-time performance monitoring system for contact centers, implementing machine learning algorithms for immediate detection of operational issues and automated decision making for performance optimization.

Title: Machine learning for real-time call center workforce planning
Abstract: Machine learning approach for real-time call center workforce planning, enabling dynamic adjustment of staffing levels based on predictive analytics and immediate decision making for operational efficiency.

Title: Edge computing for real-time call center decision support
Abstract: Edge computing architecture for real-time call center decision support, leveraging distributed machine learning models for ultra-low latency decision making and immediate response to operational changes.
